pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw:
I have run some of the tests and they are working. There seems no space left on Jenkins, so the thorough test has not been done yet 

The `meda/gui/fonts/baemuk.txt` was added since I got a bug when I create the branch *quickstep_split_util* from **default**. 

The `quickstep.cpp` used to split was from branch **asme**, I would call it `asme_quickstep.cpp`

A good way to do code review is: 
Get a local copy of [quickstep.cpp](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ee47fbc52c129b1b81e0e5a8165aee6219e44323/deps/opende/src/quickstep.cpp?at=asme) from the *asme* branch (since I didn't find a way to compare two files with different names in two different branches), 
and name it as `asme_quickstep.cpp`

[quickstep.cpp](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/52987a1bf810c3a25acbbbc906ba83923c1fd9e8/deps/opende/src/quickstep.cpp?at=quickstep_split_util) and [quickstep_util.cpp](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/52987a1bf810c3a25acbbbc906ba83923c1fd9e8/deps/opende/src/quickstep_util.cpp?at=quickstep_split_util) are from the *quickstep_split_util* branch

open two meld window, side by side:

The left meld window compares `asme_quickstep.cpp` and `quickstep.cpp`

The right meld window compares `asme_quickstep.cpp` and `quickstep_util.cpp`

It should be easier to review change in the code

@hsu  @scpeters
content.html:
I have run some of the tests and they are working. There seems no space left on Jenkins, so the thorough test has not been done yet

The meda/gui/fonts/baemuk.txt was added since I got a bug when I create the branch quickstep_split_util from default.

The quickstep.cpp used to split was from branch asme, I would call it asme_quickstep.cpp

A good way to do code review is: Get a local copy of quickstep.cpp from the asme branch (since I didn't find a way to compare two files with different names in two different branches), and name it as asme_quickstep.cpp

quickstep.cpp and quickstep_util.cpp are from the quickstep_split_util branch

open two meld window, side by side:

The left meld window compares asme_quickstep.cpp and quickstep.cpp

The right meld window compares asme_quickstep.cpp and quickstep_util.cpp

It should be easier to review change in the code

@hsu @scpeters

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw:
These functions were static when they were in `quickstep.cpp`, but now they aren't. @hsu your thoughts? Just search this page for `static`, and it only appears in deleted or unchanged code (and this comment). Or grep the diff:
~~~
$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -d 1469 | grep static
-static void Multiply1_12q1 (dReal *A, const dReal *B, const dReal *C, int q)
-static void compute_invM_JT (int m, dRealPtr J, dRealMutablePtr iMJ, int *jb,
-static void multiply_invM_JT (int m, int nb, dRealMutablePtr iMJ, int *jb,
-static void multiply_J (int m, dRealPtr J, int *jb,
-static void multiply_J_invM_JT (int m, int nb, dRealMutablePtr J, dRealMutablePtr iMJ, int *jb,
-static inline dReal dot (int n, dRealPtr x, dRealPtr y)
-static inline void add (int n, dRealMutablePtr x, dRealPtr y, dRealPtr z, dReal alpha)
 static void CG_LCP (dxWorldProcessContext *context,
-static int compare_index_error (const void *a, const void *b)
-static inline dReal dot6(dRealPtr a, dRealPtr b)
-static inline void sum6(dRealMutablePtr a, dReal delta, dRealPtr b)
 static void ComputeRows(
-static void DYNAMIC_INERTIA(const int infom, const dxJoint::Info2 &Jinfo, const int b1, const int b2,
~~~
content.html:
These functions were static when they were in quickstep.cpp, but now they aren't. @hsu your thoughts? Just search this page for static, and it only appears in deleted or unchanged code (and this comment). Or grep the diff:

$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -d 1469 | grep static
-static void Multiply1_12q1 (dReal *A, const dReal *B, const dReal *C, int q)
-static void compute_invM_JT (int m, dRealPtr J, dRealMutablePtr iMJ, int *jb,
-static void multiply_invM_JT (int m, int nb, dRealMutablePtr iMJ, int *jb,
-static void multiply_J (int m, dRealPtr J, int *jb,
-static void multiply_J_invM_JT (int m, int nb, dRealMutablePtr J, dRealMutablePtr iMJ, int *jb,
-static inline dReal dot (int n, dRealPtr x, dRealPtr y)
-static inline void add (int n, dRealMutablePtr x, dRealPtr y, dRealPtr z, dReal alpha)
 static void CG_LCP (dxWorldProcessContext *context,
-static int compare_index_error (const void *a, const void *b)
-static inline dReal dot6(dRealPtr a, dRealPtr b)
-static inline void sum6(dRealMutablePtr a, dReal delta, dRealPtr b)
 static void ComputeRows(
-static void DYNAMIC_INERTIA(const int infom, const dxJoint::Info2 &Jinfo, const int b1, const int b2,

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw: Again, if it's doable, let's keep function definitions the same as before. Static has to do with scoping, so I don't know if this is possible now that we've split the source code up. @scpeters @_jrivero_ any ideas?  Thanks.
content.html: Again, if it's doable, let's keep function definitions the same as before. Static has to do with scoping, so I don't know if this is possible now that we've split the source code up. @scpeters @jrivero any ideas? Thanks.

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw: it looks like we'll need to put all static functions directly in the header.  This way, things are scoped better and we don't have to rename them either.
content.html: it looks like we'll need to put all static functions directly in the header. This way, things are scoped better and we don't have to rename them either.

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw: I think it's better to have code in cpp files. I guess I don't see a compelling need to keep them as `static`
content.html: I think it's better to have code in cpp files. I guess I don't see a compelling need to keep them as static

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw: it's a scoping issue. If we remove `static` declaration, its symbols will be shared across all ode sources.
content.html: it's a scoping issue. If we remove static declaration, its symbols will be shared across all ode sources.

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw: We could rename the functions with a `qs_` prefix to add some scoping.
content.html: We could rename the functions with a qs_ prefix to add some scoping.

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw: could be a lot of lines touched, what about namespacing? create a `quickstep` namespace?
content.html: could be a lot of lines touched, what about namespacing? create a quickstep namespace?

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw: sounds good to me
content.html: sounds good to me

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw:
I added the namespace and just rebuilt the code.
For the inline function dot6, sum6, dot_n, scaled_sum, there are warnings
about inline function definition.
Is it OK if I remove the definition to quickstep_util.h to get rid of the
warning? since they are small functions with less than 10 lines.
content.html: I added the namespace and just rebuilt the code. For the inline function dot6, sum6, dot_n, scaled_sum, there are warnings about inline function definition. Is it OK if I remove the definition to quickstep_util.h to get rid of the warning? since they are small functions with less than 10 lines.

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw: unfortunately, we have no choice but to put inline functions int the header if we don't want to affect performance as a result of this PR.
content.html: unfortunately, we have no choice but to put inline functions int the header if we don't want to affect performance as a result of this PR.

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw: I can live with that for the dot and sum functions.
content.html: I can live with that for the dot and sum functions.

I personally prefer to put those code in cpp files, which would make the
header clean and concise.
content.html: I personally prefer to put those code in cpp files, which would make the header clean and concise.

content.raw: Some of these function names are really short and could have name shadowing problems? Mainly `dot` and `add`. Perhaps `dot_n` and `scaled_add`?
content.html: Some of these function names are really short and could have name shadowing problems? Mainly dot and add. Perhaps dot_n and scaled_add?

content.html: sure, or dot_product and scaled_add? Should we make this change right away in this pull request? Any other comments? @scpeters @hsu

content.html: go ahead and make the change and @hsu can comment when he gets back in the office

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw:
~~Correct, the deb has no headers installed to `/usr/include/gazebo-5.0/deps` and there are none of the `opende` headers in `/usr/include/gazebo-5.0/gazebo/physics/ode/`~~

I stand corrected; I will update in a new comment
content.html:
Correct, the deb has no headers installed to /usr/include/gazebo-5.0/deps and there are none of the opende headers in /usr/include/gazebo-5.0/gazebo/physics/ode/

I stand corrected; I will update in a new comment

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw: We do not install these headers. We only install the headers in [deps/opende/include](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/default/deps/opende/include/ode/), while these headers are added to [deps/opende/src](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/default/deps/opende/src). I think it's safe to mark them as non-`static`
content.html: We do not install these headers. We only install the headers in deps/opende/include, while these headers are added to deps/opende/src. I think it's safe to mark them as non-static

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw:
some of these are declared `inline` in deleted code, but not the added code. @hsu  does that matter?
~~~
$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -d 1469 | grep inline
-static inline dReal dot (int n, dRealPtr x, dRealPtr y)
-static inline void add (int n, dRealMutablePtr x, dRealPtr y, dRealPtr z, dReal alpha)
-static inline dReal dot6(dRealPtr a, dRealPtr b)
-static inline void sum6(dRealMutablePtr a, dReal delta, dRealPtr b)
~~~
content.html:
some of these are declared inline in deleted code, but not the added code. @hsu does that matter?

$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -d 1469 | grep inline
-static inline dReal dot (int n, dRealPtr x, dRealPtr y)
-static inline void add (int n, dRealMutablePtr x, dRealPtr y, dRealPtr z, dReal alpha)

-static inline void sum6(dRealMutablePtr a, dReal delta, dRealPtr b)

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw: let's keep them inlined if possible. I think it helps with performance, though we don't have a benchmark for it.
content.html: let's keep them inlined if possible. I think it helps with performance, though we don't have a benchmark for it.

pullrequest.title: quickstep split into quickstep and util

content.raw:
Sure, I will add that and make a commit.
I didn't find a good way for cmake *static*. But it compiles if we remove
the definition from quickstep_util.cpp to quickstep_util.h
which means, we declare and define those static functions all in the
quickstep_util.h and remove quickstep_util.cpp
content.html: Sure, I will add that and make a commit. I didn't find a good way for cmake static. But it compiles if we remove the definition from quickstep_util.cpp to quickstep_util.h which means, we declare and define those static functions all in the quickstep_util.h and remove quickstep_util.cpp
